meanings.definition: To walk or move around while asleep or in a sleepwalking state.
meanings.sent1: At night, he would somnambulate around the house, unaware of his actions.
meanings.sent2: She somnambulated through the dark room, her eyes closed in deep slumber.
meanings.sent3: The sleepwalker would somnambulate into the kitchen and make himself a sandwich without waking up.
meanings.sent4: Her mind somnambulated through dreamscapes, wandering in a realm of its own creation.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure somnambulated through the halls, haunting the old mansion.

meanings.definition: To perform the act of walking or moving around while asleep.
meanings.sent1: During the night, he would somnambulate in his sleep, often ending up in strange places.
meanings.sent2: The young child somnambulated around the room, his movements slow and unsteady.
meanings.sent3: In his dream, he somnambulated through a magical forest, encountering talking animals.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts somnambulated through memories of the past, reliving moments long gone.
meanings.sent5: The sleepwalker somnambulated on the edge of a cliff, unaware of the danger below.
